com.samysadi.acs.hardware.pu.operation

Interface ComputingOperation

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Entity, LongOperation<ComputingResource>, Notifier, Operation<ComputingResource>, Probed, RunnableEntity
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ComputingOperationDefault

    public interface ComputingOperation
extends LongOperation<ComputingResource>
    This interface defines methods to simulate a computing operation.

    When starting a computing operation, it seeks computing resource from its ProcessingUnit and keeps running until its entire length is processed, until a failure happens or until it is explicitly stopped (using appropriate method).

    You must ensure that the parent Job is started in order to start this operation, otherwise an IllegalStateException is thrown.
    If you start this operation while it has a null parent then a NullPointerException is thrown.

    If this operation has no allocated ProcessingUnit, then it will fail to start.
    Besides, the allocated ProcessingUnit must have a non null provisioner otherwise a NullPointerException is thrown.

    Implementations must take care to listen to the following notifications to stop or update the operation when:

    • NotificationCodes.OPERATION_RESOURCE_INVALIDATED The mips allocated for this operation changes (because other operations are started / stopped).
    • CoreNotificationCodes.FAILURE_STATE_CHANGED A processing unit fails. Or the device that contains the VM (of the sourceJob) fails.
    All implementation classes should provide a constructor with one argument of long type that specifies the operation length.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        ComputingOperation clone()
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Creates a clone of this entity and sets its parent to null.

        This is a deep clone method which also clones almost all children entities and sets their parents to the newly created clone. The only children which are not cloned are those implementing the UncloneableEntity interface.

        Implementations must ensure that the new clone will be independent from the current entity.

        Specified by:
        clone in interface Entity
        Specified by:
        clone in interface Notifier
        Specified by:

        Specified by:
